{
    "number": 287303,
    "data": "19,101,271,1429,1559,1949,2339,2729,3119,3769,4159,17989,18503,19531,21587,24671,27241,29297,30839,32381,33409,33923,36493,44203,47287,51913,55511,64763,286999,289049,293149,295199,301349,305449,323899,332099,336199,350549,375149",
    "name": "Primes that can be generated by the concatenation in base 4, in descending order, of two consecutive integers read in base 10.",
    "example": [
        "3 and 4 in base 4 are 3 and 10 and concat(10,3) = 103 in base 10 is 19;",
        "5 and 6 in base 4 are 11 and 12 and concat(12,11) = 1211 in base 10 are 101."
    ],
    "maple": [
        "with(numtheory): P:= proc(q,h) local a,b,c,d,k,n; a:=convert(q+1,base,h); b:=convert(q,base,h); c:=[op(a),op(b)]; d:=0; for k from nops(c) by -1 to 1 do d:=h*d+c[k]; od; if isprime(d) then d; fi; end: seq(P(i,4),i=1..1000);"
    ],
    "mathematica": [
        "With[{b = 4}, Select[Map[FromDigits[Flatten@ IntegerDigits[#, b], b] &, Reverse /@ Partition[Range[0, 370], 2, 1]], PrimeQ]] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, May 23 2017 *)"
    ],
    "xref": [
        "Cf. A000040, A052089."
    ],
    "keyword": "nonn,base,easy",
    "offset": "1,1",
    "author": "_Paolo P. Lava_, May 23 2017",
    "references": 0,
    "revision": 10,
    "time": "2017-05-24T09:13:30-04:00",
    "created": "2017-05-24T09:13:30-04:00"
}
